title: TB Email Sync to Gmail Account Results in Current Date on Old Emails.
content: I am moving email from one gmail account to another (for space concerns) using Thunderbird as my import/export tool. This worked well until today. All email imported to TB (using "google takeouts", imapi) works great. But when sync'd to my new gmail account, all old emails are showing the current date, rather than the actual dates. Please help me correct this new issue.
creator: brucebenjaminlevin

title: files
content:
trying to open a link google sent me in regards to deceased fathers email content followed instructions can not get it to work> been to a computer store for help and they can not get it either>

ear Jasmine Tietz: We have completed our investigation and have sent you an email containing a link to a secure portal to electronically download the requested email content available in the Gmail account, INTOTHEFUTURES0957@GMAIL.COM. In order to open the email content (the file that ends in “.mbox”), use any program capable of reading .mbox format files. One such program is Mozilla Thunderbird. To use Thunderbird, please follow the instructions listed below: 1. Visit Mozilla.org and download the program Thunderbird 2. Follow the instructions and install Thunderbird on your computer. Close Thunderbird after you have completed installation. 3. Open the following path/folder on your computer: 4. On Windows XP/2000, the path is C:\Documents and Settings\[User Name]\Application Data\ Thunderbird\Profiles\xxxxxxxx.default\ 5. On Windows 95/98/Me, the path is usually C:\WINDOWS\Application Data\Thunderbird\Profiles\ xxxxxxxx.default\ 6. On Windows 7, the path is C:\Users\[user name]\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\ xxxxxxxx.default\ 7. On Mac OS X, the path is /Users/[User Name]/Library/Thunderbird/Profiles/xxxxxxxxx.default 8. Look for the “Mail” folder and then the folder named “Local Folders.” 9. Copy and paste the “.mbox” file into “Local Folders.” 10. Open Thunderbird. When you open Thunderbird you'll see the mbox file under “Local Folders.” Google cannot provide further technical support. If you are in need of further assistance please visit the website listed below or contact an IT professional. For further information please visit http://support.mozillamessaging.com/en-US/home We thank you for your understanding and cooperation during this proces
creator: jasminetietz

title: If not showing, how do I get the main window to show?
content:
Basic UI: my wife had three message windows showing but not the main inbox. This is running on a Mac. Cmd-1 in any of the windows did NOT display the Inbox. AND THERE AREN'T ANY MENU OPTIONS THAT ARE APPARENT TO BRING UP THE MAIN WINDOW! What?! Can someone tell me how I'm supposed to bring up the main window with my message list if it isn't already showing? (And please don't tell me to go to Settings. That worked, indirectly, but it's the least intuitive approach I think I've ever seen.)

Seriously, this was frustrating and embarrassing, since I recommended Thunderbird to her.

title: Cannot install addons with Thunderbird 115 on Linux
content:
I am attempting to install add-ons via the Thunderbird Add-Ons Manager. When I click "Add to Thunderbird", a window pops up requesting that I confirm the install. I click on the blue "Add" button, but nothing happens. The extension isn't installed and the confirmation window doesn't go away. I also tried to install from downloaded XPI files but the same issue occurred. This happened with several add-ons so far including the following:

  • Thunderbird Conversations
  • CardBook

I attempted to follow the following support articles:

  • Troubleshoot Mode Thunderbird
  • Unable to install add-ons (extensions or themes) in Thunderbird

I don't think the issue is due to an add-on incompatibility, but I'm not sure as I don't see any errors.
creator: tim279

content:

Is there an option where the signature is above the reply? As we speak, the signature is right below the reply email, instead of being beneath the email body text which has just been compiled.


Thank you in advance, Michael

title: Thunderbird can't log in to Hotmail
content: Suddenly today Thunderbird won't access either of our Hotmail accounts. Error message reads "Login to server imap-mail.outlook.com with username my.name@hotmail.com failed." After several prompts to Retry/Enter New Password/Cancel, I even put the correct password in with no success and eventually received another message "Server has disconnected. The server may have gone down or there may be a network problem." Neither of these are true: I can access the server on my browser so I know the password is correct. Both my late husband's and my hotmail accounts are affected this way. Help! I am nearly 80 and not terribly computer literate and somebody else set Thunderbird up for me years ago because I wanted to be able to archive my messages locally (offline) and now it's suddenly stopped working.

title: A levelező nem tudja megnyitni a gmail fiókokat.
content:
Ha valaki tudva segíteni...Új gépet vettem, át akartam rá telepíteni a mozzilla levelezőt, az első a fő email címet beírtam kézzel. Ez alapján a levelező megpróbálta a többi email címet is megnyitni. A gmail minden fiókhoz kézzel beírt jelszót kért, de hiába írtam be a válsz a 400 hiba amit ide másolok. 400. Ez egy hiba.

A szerver nem tudja feldolgozni a kérelmet, mert helytelenül formázott. Ne próbálja újra. Ez az összes információnk.

Egy idő után már az elsőt sem tudta megnyitni. Végignéztem az összes leírást, megpróbáltam megcsinálni a tanácsokat, de nem jött össze semmi. Nem tudom, hogy hogyan lehetne helyrehozni? Úgy hozzá szoktam, hogy nem szeretnék másik levelezőre váltani. Az újratelepítés sem jött be. Köszi: Csabi
creator: csabi57

title: TB 115.7.0 - Calibri Light Font Issue on macOS
content:
Hi,

Upon installation of TB for macOS Sonoma 14.3, Calibri font wasn't available which is fair as it belongs to MS but as advised on old posts on this forum, I took the font from MS Office directory and reinstalled it and Calibri appeared in the TB fonts list. But if I do the same steps for Calibri Light font, it doesn't appear in the fonts list. When I click on my signature which is in Calibri Light, it says "Calibri Light, sans-serif (not installed)" Ref screenshots attached.

I also followed the steps from another post (Ref: Bug 1367495) in which I had to modify the preference "gfx.content.azure.backends" to "direct2d1.1,cairo" but it also didn't make any difference. Restarted the computer, restarted TB as well but still the issue is there and there is no TB update available as well.

Could anyone please guide me on how I can install Calibri Light font.

Thanks, Hassan
creator: hassanjamil7

title: Thunderbird not opening PDFs correctly but only on one mail account
content:
Hello

I use Thunderbird and have a 2 different email accounts, lets say A and B.

When I get sent PDF's and try to open them using A, it does not work. It opens in Acrobat Reader but often just greys out and says cant be opened or when it does open it then cant be printed.

However, if I get the same email cc'd to B or if I send directly on to B (from A) I can open the pdf no problems at all.

I've checked to make sure Thunderbird (supernova), Acrobat Reader and Windows 11 etc are all up to date.

Is there a way to correct this as although minor its frustrating having to duplicate emails.

Thanks
creator: Pthrowaway3145464

title: My Thunderbird Quit working this morning. Apparent OAUTH2 Problem.
content:
Windows 10. Thunderbird 115.7.0 32-bit. Email address is at hotmail.com, so it's an old account that's now at outlook.com This is a personal email account not related to any business nor to Office 365 or anything like that. I have had the account for decades.

Thunderbird quit working with my hotmail account this morning. It goes into an Invalid Password Loop, even when I respond with the correct password. I can logon to my hotmail account just fine with a browser. It's just not the same positive user experience as using Thunderbird.

I'm sure the problem must have to do with OAUTH2.

The outgoing SMTP server is outlook.com Server name is imap-mail.outlook.com Port is 993 Connection security is SSL/TLS Authentication method is Normal Password

Changing Authentication method to OAuth2 does not solve the problem. Instead I get a popup error message that's very hard to capture that is to the effect that "The imap server imap-mail.outlook.com does not support the selected authentication message". It's like I need to use a different imap server. I found one site that said to use outlook.office365.com but I don't really use office365. I may give that a try anyway.

I don't see any other account settings that seem relevant
creator: thejerrybryan

creator: campersub

title: MacOS: Quit Dialog Needed (CMD+Q vs CMD+W)
content:
In the context of Supernova and improvements, for Mac users, I request that we (finally) have a confirm-before-quit dialog. Similar to Firefox and others. On the Mac, CMD+W (close window) and CMD+Q are next to each other, it's so easy to make a mistake -- and still, Thunderbird just closes. This can be very frustrating when you're in the middle of something and/or have other TB windows open.

Fortunately, I believe this is easy to fix and implement.

How can we get this on track for implementation?
creator: forrie1

Which email address is this - the new one I want, or an existing one I have? Then it asks for a password. Is this a new password? Or is it the password used when I set up the domain with 1&1. Or is is the normal password associated with the existing email address I may have just entered? Every combination I try either fails or results in 'unable to log on to server'. Thanks.

title: Default HTML Viewer in Thunderbird - Can Not Change After Latest Update
content:
The default HTML viewer in Thunderbird 115.7.0 (as of 24 Jan 2024) changed from Microsoft Edge to Mozilla FireFox 122.0 after an earlier Thunderbird update several days ago.

I went to Tools | Settings | General | Files & Attachments to change the HTML Content Type "Action" back to Microsoft Edge. There was no change to the setting. I then selected "Delete Action" to remove the HTML entry from the list. However, I can't add the HTML entry back into the list.

How do I add "HTML" back to the "Content Type" list and then select the HTML viewer that I want?
creator: TQinOH

title: Logged into wrong yahoo IMAP account
content:
I'm just getting started with Thunderbird on Windows 10. To test it, I set up my yahoo IMAP account xxxxx777@yahoo.com using a yahoo app password. It worked fine, so I deleted that account and set up my 'real' yahoo IMAP account, which is xxxxx@yahoo.com, using another app password from Yahoo. This is a different yahoo account, so I needed to get another app password. Again, that account worked fine.

However I then chose to delete that account on Thunderbird and return to using my xxxxx777@yahoo.com yahoo IMAP account, by getting a new app password and following the Thunderbird instructions for setting up an account. The trouble is that Thunderbird is now connecting to my xxxxx@yahoo IMAP server and receiving those emails and folders instead of my xxxxx777@yahoo.com emails and folders. I have uninstalled and reinstalled Thunderbird and rebooted the computer. Thunderbird 'account settings' is correct.

The first tab in Thunderbird is "email- xxxxx777@yahoo.com", and the folders that follow are from my xxxxx@yahoo.com account. Each time I receive an email on my xxxxx@yahoo.com account, it shows up in Thunderbird under my xxxxx777@yahoo.com account.

I'm stumped.

Thanks, David
creator: dungernh
